handDesc.handNote: Unknown Hand This hand is unknown but thought not David Livingstone's.

div.p:
Days May
Kasonso's vilvillage - attack of Driver Ants 9 -
called Kalanda - RtRivulet Loele - Lake Liemba 10 -
or Tanganyika - fit of insensibility - Lake 11 -
Pambete vilvillage - Mazitu - Mombo's vilvillage 12 -
Cotton the PernambuccoPernambuco kind - silly -
Deserters - having no complaint - Chitimba 13 -
Meet Arabs at Chitimba's Sultan's letter 14 -
their kindness - fighting with Nsama
Lake fishes - slope of watershed at Chibue's 15
Chambeze & Luapula shewshow to goes to Casembe
the Basango or Wasango of Merere chief 16 -
Ulungu country of Baulungu - politeness of 17 -
make peace with Nsama or Insama 18 -
Arab wedding - Arab regard to New Moon 19 -
Captives to be returned - Earthquake 20 -
Huts lent to strangers - native employments -
Peace with Insama - fire in village 21 -
Tembe building - Tipotipo the Arab 22 -
who conquered Insama - perforated stone -
as a charm at the gateway of village -
Slavery makes bad neighbourhood 23 -
Arab account of Van der Decken at Kilimanjaro 24 -
Large spider inside huts - small ant -
Touraco - Callosities on shoulders of
the regular porters - March West - Lofu 25 -
West to Hara - to Insama's vilvillage - 26 -
his people handsome - marriage of the
daughter of Insama to Hameas - bride
escapes - March North - fire at 27 -
Hara - Prayers offered for Hamees to 28 -
Harasji - Chisera or Moero atapa -
Kamosenga RRiver - Lopere country
Sun rises & sets - Koran says so & Syde 29 -
sees it and thus it must be - Goitre
mode of changing masters by slaves 30 -
Lines of denudation as we march
Westwards RRiver Choma - chifupa's
vilvillage - Luao RRiver - the march 31 -

Days June
slave esprit de Corps - 1
vilvillage Kabwabwata in Kabuire DtDistrict -
Chitimba dead - Arabs resolve to return -
We go to Moero - Up East side of Lake S-South 2 -
Reach Kalongosi R-River & enter Lunda 3 -
Fishes of Kalongosi
RtRivulet Chungu where Dr Lacerda died 4 -
White headed swallows (psallidoprocnepsalidoprocne)
palm oil - RtRivulet Lunda & Casembe's 5
Lakelet Mofwé - Muhamad bin Saleh
Muhamad Bogarib - cropped ears
a dwarf - Grand reception by Casembe 6 -
Casembe or Kasembe = his queen 7 -
Luapula enters a marsh at S-South end of Moero 7 -
Perembe - mode of shaking hands 8 -
Change of Casembe towns 9 -
Despatch to Lord Clarendon NoNumber 2 - 10 DecDecember/67 10
Geographical Despatch - 11 - 12 - 13 - 14 - 15
Despatch 16 - 17 - 18 - 19
Return from Casembe's - Kalongosi R-River 20 -
Plains flooded by the Luao 21 -
vilvillage Kabwabwata - ground nuts - -
Detained by superabundance of water -
Underground houses in rocks - Rua 22 -
Mofwé & elephants - bigotry 23 -
superstition of ill luck -
Detained in common with Wanyamwesi 24 -
- No Moslem missions known 25 -
in East Africa - Koran never translated - -
into native tongues - Mungo Park - -
Katanga gold - Satan's - -
Numbo or Nyumbo roots a remedy -
for Nausea & vomiting 26 -
Mpweto's Lualaba & Lufira Rs-Rivers 27 -
Return to Kabwabwata - -
Inundation still great in North 28 -
Chowambe & springs of Nile - Ulenge - -
752 Dayspage = month
DecievedDeceived in coming North during inundation - 29th June
Resolve to try & go to Lake Bemba or Bangweolo =
My attendants refuse to go & abscond on various pretences =
abetted by "Mpamari" - Leave with four attendants =
One deserts at Luao - Will go forward notwithstanding =
Excavations in Kabuire = Muabo's country = 30th
cross Luao by a bridge - wading in flooded lands =

Rainfall 1st July & onwards 1st July
Wading = reach Moero = Lake higher than before 9th
Fish baskets - Katette - bunu - & hot fountain =
use for hole in cartilage of the nose - NyinaKas- =
-anga = villages deserted on account of wild beasts =
through tangled Nyassi - cross Kalungosi R-River =
off through forest - Bark cloth cutters politeness =
Fungafunga's vilvillage - RtRivulet Muatize - Chirongo - Mandapala 10th
annoyance from the over officious = cold =
RtsRivulets in flood - sent to Cazembe - Mazitu raid -11th
RtRivulet Chungu - Cazembe's town = Pereira's visit =
Altitudes above the sea 12th July & onwards 12th

Resume journal at 25th July - on Missions 25th= 23d
Dr Lacerda = An Ujijian killed by one of his people =
Cazembe appeases the Ujijians or Wayeiye =
Monteiro's visit - no goods forced from =
Portuguese Expeditions mere slaving journeys =
Perembe the "oldest inhabitant" - List =
of Cazembe's = planting the palm oil palm =
Perch - Cazembe always sensible =
His people litigious = the Queen = Moari 26th
Hot by day though winter - Cazembe's advice 27th
Arab attention to lucky days = sacrifices =
Holcus sorghum ripe = Cazembe esteemed =
case of crim - con -criminal conviction dismissed summarily =
Kanengwa Rt-Rivulet Slave trader used =
as a means of punishing young wives =
by silly old men - old men numerous 28th
Cazembe presents a biut of whitebait =
Malumbi a root somewhat like potato =
page 753
Queen Moari a ñombengombe or Kifuta 29th July
slaves often criminals and sold for crimes =
RtRivulet Mbereze = lion of Nyassi or long grass =
small bears distinguish Arabs of African blood =
Birds - minute bee - sphex - RtRivulet Luda puta - & =
Moenempanda - Reception - jaunty walking 30th
or imitation of their betters as of George IVth cravat =
R-River Luongo - bridge = Moenempanda anxious =
to get into debt but careless as to getting out of it 31st
song of six slaves in slavesticks = a lady =
A grave in the still still forest - Kizinga =
smokes begin - Chikumbi = Write letters - =

Summary of sources of Nile 1st August
Chikumbi refuses a guide for good reasons! =
Banyamwezi expel Mazitu & are attacked 2 -
Leave for Bangweolo Lake - Kombokombo =
surrounded by a rabble = one good soul in it =
Moigge's stockade = "speaking mice" coo! coo!! =
Sponge Meshwe = young men volunteer to carry me 3d -
Mapuni's village near Lake Bangweolo - =
Bible - Masantu's village on its shores - 4th
spring Chipoka = cowries in hair in fashion =
Motsikiri or Motsikisi tree yielding fat - =
many canoes and children = angling = leave =
Masantu's in canoe - Lifunge islet - =
Kisi islet - Mpabala islet - canoe men =
had stolen their canoe from Kisi - =
Mpabala islet after dark = dream - 5th -
stand stare of many people - Chirube Islet =
Kasango uninhabited islet in distance 6-
canoe men in a flurry - Had to give in =
to losing two of four days hire = size of Lake =
Islets do not diminish size of watery acreage =
Lokinga MtsMountains Kone MtsMountains no =
Derbyshire neck seen at Bangweolo =
sandy bottom - Return North =
ProbocisProboscis & poison bag of Tsetse =
page 754
Reach Kizinga = way opening out before me paged August
confusion produced by Mazitu raid - 7th August
Banyamwezi copper smelting = conical hammer =
cold winds = Hot fountain in Baloba country 8-
Reports of Bonyolo people = Lake Chipokola ? =
or Kiñkonza = feeling my way - "Kaskas" =

Note on climate of the watershed written 27 AugAugust - =
continued on pages marked 8 - 9 - 10 & 11 AugAugust - 8. - 11 August
Additional note & Syde bin Habib's report - 11th
swallows return - Kite when seen - inundation Note on
Note written on 5th OctrOctober on detention at Kizinga 12
Irritable ulcers how to treat 13th
cross Luongo - Lofubu - Papusi - Luena - =
and Kalungosi at Mosolo - 500 of Insama's 14 oldest map
people meet us - follow road between ranges =
on the East of Moero = From Luau RtRivulet =
go over to Muabo = refuse to shewshow his =
strongholds the excavations in the hills =
Syde bin Habib = his brother killed in Rua =
success of in trading & plundering - Mullam sent for My Runaway attendants beg to be recievedreceived again =

Note on the discovery of the sources of the Nile 15 - 16 - 17 - 18 -
written on 16th August last -
Additional note on change of climate
from alteration of level of the land - 18 - 19
Lake Nyassa and Tanganyika altitudes & distance 19
Suaheli idea of relation of Tanganyika &
Okara or Ukerewe - Dagara's proposal 19th
Lakes Okara or Ukerewe - Naibash & =
Baringo run into one Lake - Detention 20
slaves captured & not criminals die - of -
broken hearts - RecieveReceive back the runaways -
Meröe lost city - African mode of beckoning -
differs from ours & nodding too - zebra killed -
Bones of animals as fuel wife fled from her husband - fugitive slave -
caught - Muhamad Bogharib's kindness 21 -
Burton's pet name indicated fear in whom? -
Depart for Ujiji, intention frustrated 22 -
Warlike demonstration - excitement - -
& effects - three people murdered -
-
755
slave was begun by Bin Juma - country roused August 22 -
stockade built & attacked on three sides - care -
of Imbozhwa or Babemba to secure wounded -
Five chiefs united in attack = prisoner killed -
Three days fighting - mistake of the Arabs - visit -
of Muabo's men - slave owners bad neighbours 23d
assumptions of - dear captives - Fear that -
slaves may escape in a retreat - of course 24
they would - Babemba shewshow fight again - -
strengthen stockade in fear - -
Nkisi - tulubi or idols - Two deities - Reza -
Advice asked but not given so long as bin Juma -
keeps the stolen woman & fish - think that I must -
follow Muhamad out of the false position but 25
resolve to run the risk of attack - captives restored -
March unmolested - Pretty slave women all -
escape - Traders hospitality to each other 26
cotton grass & brakensbrackens shewshow damp climate -
Syde's brother dies - slaves escape entirely -
No forgiveness for bloodshed by Moslem Arabs -
Chisabi the chief and dead elephant - -
cross Lofunso River - - Syde bin Habib -
reports of Rua and Katanga - Breed -
of short legged goats - Gold in pool of a -
waterfall - West Lualaba or Lofu goes -
with Lufira into a Lake in Rua - -
Robber islands in East Lualaba -
Notes on Lufira from a native hunter -
Fountain of Lufira - Lofu & Liambai - -
in and Earthen mound = "Segulo" = anthill -
Christmas Day - at - MtMount Kalanga - -
False reports of English steamer 27 -
River Lufuko - to Tanganyika East 28 -
Pneumonia from being wet once too often -
carried to confluence of Lofuko Parra -
Extract the insect called "Funye from -
body & limbs - Embark on Lake -
756
Copy of letter to Lord Stanley now August
Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs 29 -
Copy continued 30
Copy of DoDitto continued - 31 -

Copy of DoDitto continued - 1 September
Copy of DoDitto finished - 2 -
Copy of letter to Seyed Majid & to Sultan Abdullah 3 - 4
journal continued - Kasanga Islet 5-
Cross Lake - evidence of a fresh current -
Kibize islet - Kabogo and Ujiji -
Goods a missing by theft - Ill conditioned -
Arab Zahor our host at Kasanga -
Canoes smashed in a storm -
the Masika season - finish letters for home 6 -
Thani's arrival reported - Malachite = Syde -
bin Habib's brother killed by Bakatala of -
West Lualaba - Rock dwellings Mokwamba -
English sympathy with slave holding - 7 -
Ujijian fear of my letters - change house -
Tanganyika encroachment Eastwards -
Floating Confervae shewshow the current - curious 8 -
idea of the Ujijians as to the waterflow - -
Visitors from Mokamba of Usige or Uzige -
Feeling for the way - Duplicity of headman 9-
at Ujiji - Resolve to go to Manyema rather -
than to Mokamba - Leave Ujiji -
Kabogo MtMount - ⌃calms - at full moon crossing place to Kasenge 11
sound & lose part of line 326 fathoms -
pull all night - man land at Kasenge -
Baguha honest - BanyamwezBanyamwezi not -
RRiver Lagumbe - Trees covered with -
Lichens mark humidity - Peace signal -
River Lobumba called further West -
Lobumba Luasse Luamo - SeptSeptember 12 -
RRiver Loungwa deep cut - Black -
smoke lowering temperature 13 -
Kibila hot fountain - Kunde's -
at RtRivulet Katamba - -
757
Suaheli superstition as to elephants September
MtMount Moloni - Large trees - Dugumbe 13-
Meet parrots and find palm trees -
over high mountains with fine rills 14 SeptrSeptember
Monandenda's - houses - Westing = 15 SeptrSeptember
Moenekuss or Bambarre mixing -
blood with strangers - nasty wood -
Fear of Manyuema cannibalism -
Soko or gorillahgorilla rain medicine -
Soko's house or nest - Host spring -
circumcision general in Manyuema -
small variety of elephant - 16 SeptrSeptember
Nigger Moslem feats - copper rings -
Go westwards Lualaba RRiver 17 SeptrSeptember
Manyuema houses - clean -
Arab propagation not of faith but -
of bugs and Syphilis - House -
wife thrift - Isolation of the -
people - country beautiful -
Maize its own thatch - suspicion -
Why come so far if we have food -
Slaves not wanted by Manyuema 18 SeptSeptember
Moenekirumbo's people afraid 19
and shewshow us out of the country -
journal to be continued after -
Despatches NoNumber 1st Bambarre 20 SeptSeptember
15th NovrNovember 1870 ends 27 SeptrSeptember
Despatch NoNumber 2 - Earl of Clarendon
Dated Ujiji 1st NovrNovember 1871 - being
thanks for search Expedition
of Young and NoNumber 2 - to Lord
Clarendon of same date 1st NovrNovember -
Despatch to Earl Granville
NoNumber 3 - Ujiji 14 NovrNovember 1871
enclosing a complaint sent
to Dr Kirk and our Government
over changes by Ludha (to Dr Kirk) 17 OctrOctober
